intro: [WRONG START] Dalea pogonathera var. walkeraa, commonly known as the Texas needlepod milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, spiny stems and small, pinkish to reddish flowers. The plant produces small, elongated pods that contain several seeds, typical of many legumes. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in prairie and steppe habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
